heaviest_rainfall.status: The largest amount of rain ever recorded is on 04 January 2025 when 36.8mm fell at a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour over the 37.2 hour event.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The heaviest rain was recorded on 02 September 2025 with a peak rate of 27.0mm per hour.  The storm lasted 15.0 hours and had a total rainfall of 21.19mm.

longest_rain.status: The record duration for continuous rain was set on 04 January 2025, the storm lasted 37.2 hours with a total precipitation of 36.8mm and it reached 4.6mm per hour at times.

most_lightning.status: The lightning strike count peaked at 23 on 07 September 2025, the highest since recording started on 11 April 2025.

storm.status: No storms are expected.  The last storm was observed on 03 October 2025 and continued for 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is no cold snap at the moment.  This year has experienced 6 cold snaps, with an average of 3.7 per year.

extreme.status: The largest temperature gap recorded is 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C) on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: At the moment, it is not a heatwaves.  This year has seen 6 heatwavess; typically, 1.9 heatwavess happen every year.

tropical.status: The previous tropical night was on 18 July 2025, with only 62 in total since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (188°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: 93.7 mph is the largest wind gust recorded on 13 October 2012.

run.status: To date, the maximum wind run recorded is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: 93.7 mph is the largest wind speed recorded on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the inside temperature (down 2.3°C) and drier conditions in rainfall (down 0.4 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (down 300 m) and pressure (down 9 mbar).

The past week and month had observable variation in feels like temperature (up 44.2°C), dew point temperature (up 41.3°C), outside temperature (up 43.7°C), and inside temperature (up 51.9°C) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 300.0m higher than yesterday, 163.6m higher than the past week, 31.0m higher than the past month.

Yesterday, the cloud levels ranged from a minimum of 817m to a maximum of 2540m, averaging 1738.0m; the past week and month had slightly higher averages of 1574.4m and 1707.0m respectively.
cloud levels.summary: Partial cloudiness with some periods of sun.

summary.summary: Inside; on the cooler side. Outside; cold temperatures are forecasted. Also, the air will feel dry and near calm conditions. Showers, partial cloudiness with some periods of sun, and the light is absent. Weather could become unsettled.

washing.phrase: The conditions are favourable for drying your laundry outside right now but, as always, monitor the situation for changes to the weather.
